meanings.definition: A piece of parchment inscribed with religious texts and attached to the doorpost in Jewish homes.
meanings.sent1: The mezuzot on the doorpost contained sacred writings.
meanings.sent2: In Jewish homes, it is customary to affix mezuzot to the doorposts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to play with the mezuzot on the doorpost.
meanings.sent4: The mezuzot on the doorpost were like silent guardians of the house.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the mezuzot made them stand out on the doorpost.

meanings.sent1: She collected mezuzot from different places to display in her home.
meanings.sent2: The rabbi handed out mezuzot to the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The children were fascinated by the shiny mezuzot.
meanings.sent4: The mezuzot lined up neatly on the shelf, each holding a special meaning.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind rattled the mezuzot hanging on the doorpost.
